page.title: 07Recreation&Community Centre.
page.content: In 1934 on this site opened the Dilhorne Pavilion & Pleasure Grounds, which became the Miners Welfare Institute, this ran until 1967. The present use as a Community and Recreation Centre was threatened with closurer in 1979 when the entrance Lodge required structual support etc., at a cost of 3000 pounds approx.. This was raised by the committee of Trustees in a variety of ways. Since then the committee have improved and modernised the Centre to include a new tiolet block with disabled facilities, re-making of the tenis court,improvement of the bowling green which stands on the foundations of the old Hall. Improvements have also been made to the children's playground and the recreation ground where the village carnival takes place each year.
